page.title: 16Wortley-Sheep Farm
page.content: Home Farm is in the centre of Wortley. The same family have rented it for over 70 years. The farmhouse and buildings are very old. At present the farm has 3,000 sheep and 3 working dogs. Most of the fields are grazing land for the sheep but 20 acres are used for silage. The farmer also rents land on the moors as extra grazing. The busiest time of year is spring when all the lambs are born. If the lambs are small or weak they are kept in the barn and hand fed. In May all the sheep are sheared. The farmer can shear a sheep very quickly. He gets the fleece off in one piece. The sheep have to be stamped with the farmer's mark before they are allowed out. They also have to be dipped to kill insects. Most of the young lambs are sent to merket to be sold for fattening.
